Posts.Content: On May 24, 2010 11:02 PM maggigioffre wrote: My name is Maggi G.  I am 55 years old and had a bilateral mastectomy on 9-22-08. I chose to have implants instead of breast reconstruction.  Since then I have had Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome.- burning, tightness, pain, pain, pain. I live in Pittsburgh but would travel anywhere in the world to find a physician to treat me using nerve blocks (neurilysis) and or any other treatment other than the ones that i have tried and have not worked for me: Oinments Cymbalta Acupuncture Hypotherapy Physical therapy Narcotics - these are helpful, but I don't want to be on them the rest of my life If you know of a pain center or specific doctor that knows and treat PMPS, please respond to me via email or phone: --Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection, email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html-- Maggi, I feel for you. I'm currently looking into the same thing. I'm in S Florida and I know Cleveland Clinic here and in Ohio are doing it. I have only talked to 1 woman who has had it and this was recent. So far so good for her but I'm waiting to see how long , how well it works.
Posts.Title: POST MASTECTOMY PAIN SYNDROME

Posts.Content: On Jun 01, 2010 3:11 AM joeys_mom wrote: Just taking the hormonpills ,no surgery ,no chemoo, no radiation.. I feel great but is that normal?? I put myself on a diet and some alternative stuff.. Just wanted to know if others are just taking the meds without the surgery or stuff.. I took it for about a year and then I had a bilateral mastectomy Oct 09. Unfortunately it didn't help me to much. I have met many women who are using it alone. I was using a low fat, low carb high protein diet with vitamin supplements.
Posts.Title: tomaxofin and nothing else???
